article_title: Bahn Drops Long-Distance Bus Expansion Plan, Sueddeutsche Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LM791207SXKX01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-06-03/bahn-drops-long-distance-bus-expansion-plan-sueddeutsche-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-NTge6SS"}   Deutsche Bahn AG, Germany’s national rail company, won’t expand its network of long-distance buses when legislation to increase competition in that market is introduced, Sueddeutsche Zeitung reported, citing a company spokesman.    The company had said hitherto that it planned to buy more buses and invest in marketing with the aim of becoming market leader; it’s changed its mind because of the likelihood of heavy competition, the newspaper said.     Published on ‎3‎ ‎June‎, ‎2011‎ ‎07‎:‎46        Have a confidential tip for our reporters? GET IN TOUCH    Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
